question_text: Which issue may occur when using a long coaxial cable with a cable modem that relies on DOCSIS standards?
answer_options: RJ45 signal interference from telephone lines
DOCSIS modems require analog signals which degrade quickly
Signal attenuation can prevent synchronization with the provider
F connector can’t physically support long coax runs
correct_answer: Signal attenuation can prevent synchronization with the provider
explanation: Long coaxial cable runs can cause signal loss (attenuation), potentially disrupting the DOCSIS modem’s ability to sync with the cable provider.
